intro: Semeiostachys ugamica, commonly known as the golden spike grass, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green inflorescences that resemble spikes, which are typical of the genus Semeiostachys. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests and wetlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
